articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Devastation of World War I prompted critical medical advances
articles.description: The First World War was unprecedented in its scale and impact, forcing medicine to respond and evolve. At the American Hospital in Paris, doctors developed better anesthesia and a precursor to the modern  ambulance, among other advances.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Exclusive: On board an American missile destroyer as it pursues Russian submarines
articles.description: NBC News’ Kevin Tibbles joins the U.S. Navy aboard the Forrest Sherman, a guided missile destroyer, as officers stress the U.S. is engaged in the “Fourth Battle of the Atlantic” against Russia.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Strong winds fuel destructive Southern California wildfire
articles.description: The Woolsey Fire in Southern California continues its path of destruction across the region, strengthened by strong Santa Ana winds. Families have been forced to evacuate as firefighters work tirelessly to save homes.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Paradise, California, in ruins as Camp Fire continues to rage
articles.description: More than 4,000 firefighters are battling the blaze — the most destructive wildfire in California’s history — as it destroys entire neighborhoods. Families are desperately search for missing loved ones.

articles.title: The Royal family attends London's Festival of Remembrance
articles.description: The Royal family attended this year's Festival of Remembrance held at Royal Albert Hall in London, marking 100 years since the end of World War One. The festival began in 1927 as a way to pay tribute to those who had fought and died in the first World War.

articles.title: Prescription drug with fish oil reduces risk of heart attack or stroke, study finds
articles.description: A new study found that a prescription drug made of pure fish oil could significantly reduce the risk of heart attack or stroke. The drug, called Vascepa, is FDA approved and costs $278 a month.
